title.native: ラブひなクリスマススペシャル 〜サイレント・イヴ〜
title.romaji: Love Hina Christmas Special: Silent Eve

description:
As another round of preliminary tests approach for Keitaro, so does Christmas. And as the first Christmas of the millenium, there is a rumor that if one confesses his love on this special eve it will come true. Keitaro has decided what he needs to do on this Christmas eve, but being a retaker can he afford taking attention away from the tests on the same day...
The Winter has begun in Hinata. X-mas is coming up. There are rumors about this special christmas eve: If someone is going to confess his love on this christmas eve, any wish will come true. Keitaro decides to confess his love to Naru. But he isn't the only one confessing on this christmas eve...

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

node.description:
__Height:__ 155 cm

[Website](http://king-cr.jp/artist/horie/) | [Profile](https://www.vims.co.jp/talent_profile_detail.php?id=8) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/horieyui-blog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/horieyui_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuihorie_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yui_Horie) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A0%80%E6%B1%9F%E7%94%B1%E8%A1%A3) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/4000.html) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/YuiHorieJP)

She is a voice actress and singer currently affiliated with vims. She hosts a radio show called "Horie Yui no Tenshi no Tamago" (堀江由衣の天使のたまご "Yui Horie's Angel Eggs") and is the founding member of the singing group, Aice5. She is also a member of the band Kurobara Hozonkai, with the name YUIEL. Her hobbies include shoulder massaging, reading and eating. She has been affectionately nicknamed "Hocchan" (ほっちゃん) by her Japanese fans.

**Non-anime roles:** 
- Faruzan - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Freesia - Memento Mori (VG)
- Miranda - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Maiden - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Wagon - Ressha Sentai ToQger (Tokusatsu)
- Mine Aomori - Blue Archive (VG)
- Cotton Cookie - Cookie Run: Kingdom (VG)
- Surtr - Arknights (VG)
- Ai-chan - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Charlotte Corday - Fate/Grand Order (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/WendeeLeeVO)

Wendee Lee is an American voice actress and one of the most prolific and experienced American voice actors in the business. While she has done voicework for many video games, as well as several episodes in the Power Rangers franchise, she is particularly prolific in the dubbing of anime, where she has more credits than any other English anime voice actor with currently two hundred and fourteen credits.

__Height:__ 150cm

[Profile](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=195) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nejimakiya521)

Announced her marriage to fellow voice actor [Takeharu Onishi](https://anilist.co/staff/95751/) on March 3, 2021.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KenAkamatsu) | [Website](http://www.ailove.net/main.html) | [Blog](https://kenakamatsu.hatenablog.com/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/Akamatsu.Ken) | [Tumblr](https://kenakamatsu.tumblr.com/)

Ken Akamatsu is a Japanese mangaka from Tokyo.   

In his teenage years, Akamatsu failed the entrance exam to Tokyo University, and applied for Film Study instead (it is speculated that this is where he got the idea for Love Hina). Eventually, he became famous as an illustrator featured in Comiket (short for Comic Market, a comic convention bi-annually held in Japan). He used the pen name Awa Mizuno (水野亜和). Akamatsu, still in college, then proceeded to win the Weekly Shonen Magazine award twice. His "A Kid's Game for One Summer" was awarded the coveted 50th Shonen Magazine Newcomer's Award soon after he graduated.    

After a big hit with A.I. Love You, he finally made a grand success with his new manga, Love Hina. The series appeared in Weekly Shonen Magazine and has been collected in eleven volumes (with fourteen volumes in total), which have sold over 6 million copies in Japan, and received the Kodansha Manga Award for shōnen in 2001.  Akamatsu had added elements of his own life experiences to the story, and this was said to have induced a unique feeling to the manga especially for Western readers, whose lack of familiarity with Japanese culture for the most part added to the effect. The series, published in America in 2002, was especially well received in many overseas countries - Akamatsu was surprised that even foreign readers found Love Hina to be "cute" and to their liking.    

He is now married to his wife 'Kanon' Akamatsu, who was previously a singer/idol.

Since 2022, he has held a seat in the House of Councillors proportional representation block of the National Diet.

[Website](http://www.earthwork.ne.jp/) | [Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/uruchi1/) | [Pixiv (NSFW)](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/14536776)

Satoshi Urushihara is a Japanese manga artist and illustrator known for his distinctive style of beautiful characters. His work is the basis for anime such as Plastic Little and Legend of Lemnear, and appears in the Langrisser and Growlanser series of tactical role-playing video games.

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/ozone_maru) | [Pixiv (NSFW)](https://www.pixiv.net/users/15639)

Publishes explicit doujinshi under the name "Marumiya."

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/ozone_maru) | [Pixiv (NSFW)](https://www.pixiv.net/users/15639)

Publishes explicit doujinshi under the name "Marumiya."

As is the case with many Japanese artists, her privacy was well guarded; little is known about her life apart from her artistic career. 

During the 90s, she continued singing and also wrote for anime voice actors. From 2000, she became involved in earnest with anime and composed several songs for Wedding Peach, Fruits Basket and Love Hina. She formed the duo Melocure in 2002 with singer-songwriter Megumi Hinata, and in the following two years, the duo released several singles and an album, Melodic Hard Cure. Okazaki also produced songs during these years for artists such as Megumi Hayashibara, Mayumi Iizuka, and Yui Horie.  Her work consists mainly of ballads, and can be categorised within the spectrum of Japanese music as most closely related to J-Pop. According to her fans, the lyrics of Okazaki's songs are characterized by poetic imagery, depth of emotion, gentle optimism and simplicity.  

On May 5, 2004, Ritsuko Okazaki died suddenly at the age of 44 from septic shock as a result of septicemia. She was unable to speak any last words, and left her work unfinished.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2256470167)

After graduating from high school, Kubota went through training at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s research center before dropping out and joining [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1998. Three years later in he met [Sushio](https://anilist.co/staff/103619/) at Comiket, which led to Kubota joining [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he made his debut as an animation director on the premiere of [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/277/)'s second season.

In 2005, he made his debut as a character designer, although still jointly together with Sushio and [Takaaki Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/110187/), on the 6th [One Piece](https://anilist.co/anime/464/) movie. The film was directed by Mamoru Hosoda, which led to Kubota getting an invite to join the production of [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/) as an animation director. After this he kept working at Gainax until going freelance.

In 2012, he worked as the main character designer on [From the New World](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/) and [Robotics;Notes](https://anilist.co/anime/13599/), and a few years later he served as one on [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/), which earned him international fame.

Akio Takami is an animator, animation supervisor and character designer. Originally a member of Ashi Productions, he joined Xebec in the 90s, where he participated in most of Xebec's works and became one of the key people at the studio.

He is also the German voice of:
- Christopher Masterson as Francis in _Malcolm in the Middle_
- Donald Faison as Dr. Christopher Duncan Turk in _Scrubs_
- Simon Helberg as Howard Joel Wolowitz in _The Big Bang Theory_
- Martin Freeman as Dr. Watson in _Sherlock_
Sergio Luzi is an actor, known for Christmas in New York (2005), How the Toys Saved Christmas (1996) and Magic Sport 2 (2012).
